intro: Paepalanthus wahlbergii, commonly known as the Wahlberg's cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in spines. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months, adding a striking visual element to its desert-like habitat. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by cactus enthusiasts.
